summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the saints and faithful brothers and sisters in Christ in Colossae:
Grace to you and peace from God our Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In our prayers for you we always thank God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love that you have for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the hope laid up for you in heaven. You have heard of this hope before in the word of the truth, the gospel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that has come to you. Just as it is bearing fruit and growing in the whole world, so it has been bearing fruit among yourselves from the day you heard it and truly comprehended the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This you learned from Epaphras, our beloved fellow servant. He is a faithful minister of Christ on our behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has made known to us your love in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, since the day we heard it, we have not ceased praying for you and asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of God’s will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may walk worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing to him, as you bear fruit in every good work and as you grow in the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May you be made strong with all the strength that comes from his glorious power, so that you may have all endurance and patience, joyfully
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks to the Father, who has enabled you to share in the inheritance of the saints in the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has rescued us from the power of darkness and transferred us into the kingdom of his beloved Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in him all things in heaven and on earth were created, things visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or powers—all things have been created through him and for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself is before all things, and in him all things hold together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the head of the body, the church; he is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, so that he might come to have first place in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in him all the fullness of God was pleased to dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and through him God was pleased to reconcile to himself all things, whether on earth or in heaven, by making peace through the blood of his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you who were once estranged and hostile in mind, doing evil deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he has now reconciled in his fleshly body through death, so as to present you holy and blameless and irreproachable before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: provided that you continue securely established and steadfast in the faith, without shifting from the hope promised by the gospel that you heard, which has been proclaimed to every creature under heaven. I, Paul, became a minister of this gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am now rejoicing in my sufferings for your sake, and in my flesh I am completing what is lacking in Christ’s afflictions for the sake of his body, that is, the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I became its minister according to God’s commission that was given to me for you, to make the word of God fully known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the mystery that has been hidden throughout the ages and generations but has now been revealed to his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them God chose to make known how great among the gentiles are the riches of the glory of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is he whom we proclaim, warning everyone and teaching everyone in all wisdom, so that we may present everyone mature in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this I toil and strive with all the energy that he powerfully inspires within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I want you to know how greatly I strive for you and for those in Laodicea and for all who have not seen me face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want their hearts to be encouraged and united in love, so that they may have all the riches of assured understanding and have the knowledge of God’s mystery, that is, Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am saying this so that no one may deceive you with plausible arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I am absent in body, yet I am with you in spirit, and I rejoice to see your orderly conduct and the firmness of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you therefore have received Christ Jesus the Lord, continue to walk in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rooted and built up in him and established in the faith, just as you were taught, abounding in thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch out that no one takes you captive through philosophy and empty deceit, according to human tradition, according to the elemental principles of the world, and not according to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you have come to fullness in him, who is the head of every ruler and authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him also you were circumcised with a spiritual circumcision, by the removal of the body of the flesh in the circumcision of Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when you were buried with him in baptism, you were also raised with him through faith in the power of God, who raised him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you were dead in trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made you alive together with him, when he forgave us all our trespasses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: erasing the record that stood against us with its legal demands. He set this aside, nailing it to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He disarmed the rulers and authorities and made a public example of them, triumphing over them in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, do not let anyone condemn you in matters of food or drink or of observing festivals, new moons, or Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are only a shadow of what is to come, but the body belongs to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone disqualify you, insisting on self-abasement and worship of angels, initiatory visions, puffed up without cause by a human way of thinking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not holding fast to the head, from whom the whole body, nourished and held together by its ligaments and tendons, grows with a growth that is from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If with Christ you died to the elemental principles of the world, why do you live as if you still belonged to the world? Why do you submit to regulations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not handle! Do not taste! Do not touch!”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these regulations refer to things that perish with use; they are simply human commands and teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These have indeed an appearance of wisdom in promoting self-imposed piety, humility, and severe treatment of the body, but they are of no value in checking self-indulgence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you have been raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your minds on the things that are above, not on the things that are on earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ who is your life is revealed, then you also will be revealed with him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put to death, therefore, whatever in you is earthly: sexual immorality, impurity, passion, evil desire, and greed (which is idolatry).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On account of these the wrath of God is coming on those who are disobedient.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ways you also once followed, when you were living that life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you must get rid of all such things: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and abusive language from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie to one another, seeing that you have stripped off the old self with its practices
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have clothed yourselves with the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge according to the image of its creator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that renewal there is no longer Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, enslaved and free, but Christ is all and in all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear with one another and, if anyone has a complaint against another, forgive each other; just as the Lord has forgiven you, so you also must forgive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above all, clothe yourselves with love, which binds everything together in perfect harmony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, to which indeed you were called in one body. And be thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly; teach and admonish one another in all wisdom; and with gratitude in your hearts sing psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives and never treat them harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is your acceptable duty in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not provoke your children, or they may lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, obey your earthly masters in everything, not with a slavery performed merely for looks, to please people, but wholeheartedly, fearing the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever task you must do, work as if your soul depends on it, as for the Lord and not for humans,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you know that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward; you serve the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the wrongdoer will be paid back for whatever wrong has been done, and there is no partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, treat your slaves justly and fairly, for you know that you also have a Master in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devote yourselves to prayer, keeping alert in it with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time, pray for us as well, that God will open to us a door for the word, that we may declare the mystery of Christ, for which I am in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that I may reveal it clearly, as I should.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Conduct yourselves wisely toward outsiders, making the most of the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your speech always be gracious, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how you ought to answer everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tychicus will tell you all the news about me; he is a beloved brother, a faithful minister, and a fellow servant in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent him to you for this very purpose, so that you may know how we are and that he may encourage your hearts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is coming with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will tell you about everything here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, as does Mark the cousin of Barnabas, concerning whom you have received instructions; if he comes to you, welcome him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus who is called Justus greets you. These are the only ones of the circumcision among my coworkers for the kingdom of God, and they have been a comfort to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, greets you. He is always striving in his prayers on your behalf, so that you may stand mature and fully assured in everything that God wills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I testify for him that he has worked hard for you and for those in Laodicea and in Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give my greetings to the brothers and sisters in Laodicea and to Nympha and the church in her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when this letter has been read among you, have it read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and see that you read also the letter from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to Archippus, “See that you complete the task that you have received in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
